title: Livestock manure; key figures
maintainer_displayname: ZBO | Centraal Bureau voor de Statistiek
name: livestock-manure-key-figures
notes:
This table comprises information about livestock manure production and production of nitrogen and phosphate in manure. It also includes data on excreted nitrogen that evaporates as ammonia and other nitrogen compounds. The use of nitrogen and phosphate in agricultural holdings is calculated from the manure production and the difference between supply and removal of manure. The use of manure is related to the available spreading area based on fertilising standards. 

Data available from: 1950.

Status of the figures: 
- Figures up to and including 2013 are final figures. 
New insights in calculation methodologies can lead to recalculation of the time series. 

Changes as of 15 january 2015:
Figures for 2013 on manure transports, manure processing and manure application are added.
Provisional figures on manure production and nutrient excretion in 2014 are added.

New emission factors for ammonia from cattle and pig housing have been applied from 1990 onwards. The new emission factors are based on the latest scientific insights by Livestock Research Wageningen University. 

Furthermore emission factors for gaseous nitrogen losses of N2O from IPCC-guidelines 1996 are replaced by emission factors from IPCC-guidelines 2006 from 1990 onwards according to international agreements. Emissions of NO and N2 changed also because of their relationship with N2O emissions. 

Because of the changes in nitrogen emissions the amount of nitrogen in stored manure, transported manure and applied manure on agricultural soils has been changed.

When will new figures be published? 
To be published in the second quarter of 2015:
- More final figures on manure production and nutrient excretion in 2014.
